(UK only) }} 'Channel 4' is a British public-service television broadcaster
which began transmission on 2 November 1982. Although largely commercially self-
funded, it is ultimately publicly owned; originally a subsidiary of the
Independent Broadcasting Authority (IBA), the station is now owned and operated
by Channel Four Television Corporation, a public body established in 1990,
coming into operation in 1993. With the conversion of the Wenvoe transmitter
group in Wales to digital on 31 March 2010, Channel 4 became an entirely UK-wide
TV channel for the first time.

The channel was established to provide a fourth television service to the United
Kingdom in addition to the television licence-funded BBC's two services and the
single commercial broadcasting network, ITV.
categories: Television channels and stations established in 1982
Television channels in the United Kingdom
